abstract.p: Forrest Proper letter lauds May 4 article on shopping for used books on line

block.p: I enjoyed the Online Shopper column about Alibris and the used book trade very much and thought that it was very well done.
I enjoyed the Online Shopper column about Alibris and the used book trade very much and thought that it was very well done.

The members of the Antiquarian Booksellers Association of America (www.library.vanderbilt.edu/law/ acqs/pubr/rare.html) offer exactly the same guarantees that Alibris does, without the markup and (I immodestly add) with much more expertise in old and rare books.

Here at Joslin Hall Rare Books, I'm glad to see that the press is getting more into the story of the real tensions, distrust, bad feelings and even near-hysteria that many booksellers are feeling about the changes in our rather insular community.

Correction: May 12, 2000, Friday Because of an editing error, a letter to the editor in Circuits yesterday about online used-book sellers misstated the Web address for the Antiquarian Booksellers' Association of America. It is www.abaa.org.
